controllers

Class PlayerSelectionController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controllers.PlayerSelectionController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable

    public class PlayerSelectionController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    Player Selection Scene Controller. Links the player and player profile models to the GUI.
    Author:
    James Charnock

    • Method Detail

      • autoAssignColour

        private Player[] autoAssignColour(Player[] players)
        If a players colour is set to auto assign, then a colour that is not selected by any player is assigned.
        Parameters:
        players - The players selected.
        Returns:
        The players selected with their new, unique colours now assigned.

      • handleBeginClick

        private void handleBeginClick()
        Handles the begin button click, starts the game from the selected player colours and profiles.

      • handleColourChange

        private void handleColourChange(int index,
                                java.lang.String[] prevColourValues)
        Handles a change of a colour selection box. Removes a selected colour if it is not auto-assign, from all other colour selection boxes.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the player form.
        prevColourValues - The previous values of all profile selection boxes.

      • handleMute

        public void handleMute()
        Mutes the background audio if its currently un-muted, and un-mutes the background audio if it is currently muted.

      • handleProfileChange

        private void handleProfileChange(int index,
                                 java.lang.String[] prevNameValues)
        Handles a change of a profile selection box. That is, removes a selected player from all other profile selection boxes.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the player form.
        prevNameValues - The previous values of all profile selection boxes.

      • handleStartingCheckBox

        private void handleStartingCheckBox(int index)
        Sets the selected checkbox player as the starting player.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of player/checkbox.

      • initialize

        public void initialize(java.net.URL location,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle resources)
        Initializes the player selection GUI so that it's ready to be displayed.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
        Parameters:
        location - The location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the location is not known.
        resources - The resources used to localize the root object, or null if the root object was not localized.

        Sets the player that is to start the game.
        Parameters:

      • updatePlayerForms

        private void updatePlayerForms(boolean decrease,
                               int oldValue)
        Removes and adds player forms depending on how the number of players selected to play.
        Parameters:
        decrease - If the number of player forms is being decreased or not.
        oldValue - Number of player forms currently.

      • updateStartLabels

        private void updateStartLabels(Player[] players)
        Sets the label for the player that is starting the game.
        Parameters:
        players - The players playing the game.

      • updateTankView

        private void updateTankView(int index,
                            java.lang.String colour)
        Sets player tank images to the correct tank and colour.
        Parameters:
        index - Player number/index.
        colour - The colour to set the tank image to.
